meta.name: Rekon Trade Page Design System
meta.description: High-level design guidelines for the trade/prediction market interface. This file instructs AI to replicate the pro trading terminal aesthetic with dark backgrounds, neon accents, and data-dense layouts optimized for rapid decision-making.
meta.scope: Trade page, market detail pages, order placement interfaces, price displays, and trading activity feeds

creative_director_notes.overall_vision: The trade interface should feel like a professional esports trading terminal—dark, focused, and optimized for speed. Every element serves a purpose: displaying critical information, enabling rapid decisions, and providing clear visual feedback. The design balances information density with clarity, using color strategically to guide attention and communicate state.
creative_director_notes.emotional_tone: Confident, precise, energetic. This is not a casual interface—it's built for traders who need to act quickly. The design should inspire confidence through clarity and responsiveness.
creative_director_notes.user_experience_philosophy: Minimize cognitive load. Use color, typography, and spacing to create clear information hierarchy. Critical actions should be immediately obvious. Feedback should be instant and unambiguous.

visual_hierarchy: The trade box is the primary focal point—it should be visually prominent but not overwhelming.
Price information is secondary but critical—use larger, monospace fonts for numbers to ensure quick scanning.
Supporting information (recent trades, market info) should be clearly secondary but still accessible.
Use border weights, background opacity, and spacing to establish hierarchy without relying solely on size.
color_semantics: Yellow/Gold (#FACC15, #EAB308): Team 1, primary selection, highlights. Warm and attention-grabbing.
Blue/Cyan (#3B82F6, #22D3EE): Team 2, secondary selection, information. Cool and trustworthy.
Emerald/Green (#22C55E, #10B981): Buy actions, positive changes, success states. Growth and confidence.
Red (#EF4444, #DC2626): Sell actions, negative changes, errors. Urgency and caution.
White/Gray scales: Primary text (white/96), secondary text (white/60-80), muted text (white/40-50). Use opacity to create hierarchy.
Never use pure white (#FFFFFF) for backgrounds—always use dark surfaces with subtle borders.
information_density: Pack information efficiently but maintain readability. Use compact spacing (8-12px) between related elements.
Group related information visually through borders, backgrounds, and spacing.
Use abbreviations and short labels where context is clear (e.g., '24h Volume' not '24 Hour Volume').
Numbers should always use monospace fonts for alignment and quick scanning.
interaction_design: All interactive elements must have clear hover and active states.
Selection states should be obvious—use color fills, border changes, and subtle glows.
Buttons should feel responsive—use scale transforms (0.98 on active) and color shifts on hover.
Form inputs should have clear focus states with colored borders and subtle glows.
Disable states should reduce opacity (0.5) but remain visible—users should understand why something is disabled.
spatial_organization: Use a grid-based layout system. The trade page uses a 12-column grid on desktop.
Main content area (trade box) should be 5 columns on desktop, price display 4 columns, market info 3 columns.
On mobile, stack vertically with trade box appearing first (most important action).
Maintain consistent padding: 16-24px (lg-xl) for cards, 12-16px (md-lg) for internal spacing.
Use gap utilities (gap-4, gap-6) for consistent spacing between grid items.

background.description: Very dark backgrounds create the terminal aesthetic. Surface variations use subtle opacity differences to create depth.

borders.description: Borders are always subtle—never harsh. Use opacity to create hierarchy. Active/selected states use colored borders with 50% opacity.

team1.description: Warm yellow/gold for Team 1. Used for selection states, price displays, and team identification.

team2.description: Cool blue for Team 2. Used for selection states, price displays, and team identification.

buy.description: Emerald green for buy actions. Represents growth, positive action, confidence.

sell.description: Red for sell actions. Represents urgency, caution, exit actions.

text.description: Text hierarchy through opacity. Primary for important labels and values, secondary for supporting text, muted for hints and metadata.

semantic.description: Use for price changes, trade indicators, and status messages.

font_families.mono: 'JetBrains Mono', 'SF Mono', ui-monospace, Menlo, Monaco, 'Courier New', monospace
font_families.description: Sans-serif for UI text and labels. Monospace for all numbers, prices, and data values to ensure alignment and quick scanning.

sizes.description: Use larger sizes (2xl-3xl) for prices and critical numbers. Base-lg for labels and UI text. xs-sm for metadata and hints.

weights.description: Semibold for labels and important text. Bold for prices and critical values. Regular for body text and metadata.

line_heights.description: Tight for large numbers and prices. Snug for headings. Normal for body text.

letter_spacing.description: Wide for uppercase labels and headers. Normal for most text. Tight for large numbers.

spacing.description: Consistent 4px base unit. Use lg-xl for card padding, md-lg for internal spacing, sm-md for tight groups.

border_radius.description: Rounded corners soften the interface. Use lg-xl for cards, md-lg for buttons and inputs, full for pills.

shadows.description: Use shadows sparingly. Colored glows for active states and important actions. Standard shadows for elevation on cards.

transitions.description: Fast transitions for hover states and interactions. Keep animations subtle and purposeful—no bouncing or excessive motion.

trade_box.description: The primary trading interface card. Contains team selection, buy/sell toggle, stake input, estimated payout display, and trade button.

responsive_breakpoints.description: Use Tailwind's default breakpoints. Mobile-first approach: design for mobile, enhance for larger screens.

accessibility_guidelines.color_contrast: Ensure all text meets WCAG AA standards (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text)
accessibility_guidelines.focus_states: All interactive elements must have visible focus indicators (colored borders, rings)
accessibility_guidelines.keyboard_navigation: All interactive elements must be keyboard accessible
accessibility_guidelines.screen_readers: Use semantic HTML and ARIA labels where appropriate
accessibility_guidelines.error_communication: Errors must be communicated both visually (color, icons) and textually

implementation_notes.tailwind_classes: Use Tailwind utility classes. Prefer composition over custom CSS.
implementation_notes.conditional_styling: Use cn() utility for conditional class application (e.g., selected states).
implementation_notes.monospace_numbers: Always use font-mono for prices, amounts, percentages, and any numeric data.
implementation_notes.opacity_variants: Use Tailwind's opacity utilities (text-white/60, border-white/20) for consistent opacity levels.
implementation_notes.transitions: Apply transition-all to interactive elements for smooth state changes.
implementation_notes.responsive_text: Use responsive text sizes (text-sm sm:text-base) for better mobile experience.
implementation_notes.scrollbars: Use scrollbar-thin utility class for custom scrollbar styling on scrollable containers.
